text: SHADOWS DANCE.  A bare bulb swings from the ceiling revea clothes on a chair, puddles of water on the floor... SLEEPING EYES in and out of darkness.  The eyes open. Confusion. WIDEN ANGLE ON JONATHAN WHITE  -  a man in his early thir dark featured. He sits up.  Water splashes.  He's in a tub of long cold His neck aches like he's been sleeping forever. He looks down into the murky water around him.  A feint movement beneath the surface, something swimming  -  A SM DARK SHAPE.  Startled, he leaps from the bath. ANGLE  -  THE SWINGING LIGHT BULB.  The man's hand reache stops the light-bulb mid swing. He steps to a circular window.  The glass is cracked, cov in grime.  He wipes it, this only smears the dirt. It's dark out there.
ANGLE ON WHITE  -  from outside the window, through blurr glass. A RAPID FLYING P.O.V. PULLS BACK in silence.  The window SPECK on the side of a vast grey tower.

White shivers, cold.  He stares down at the puddle he dri the floor.  He looks at his feet and legs, covered with numerous SMALL BITES.  He dries the bloody wounds with a He picks up the clothes lying on the chair, puts them on. Loose trousers with braces, a plain shirt, leathers shoes HOLES in both soles.  In his trouser pocket he finds a ke a room number on a plastic tag. He hears splashing in the bath-tub.  He steps over, looks the murky water.  Suddenly a SMALL SILVER FISH leaps from water, lands at his feet, panting heavily and flapping ab He leans down, picks the fish up, throws it back into the water. Like a blind man, he feels the walls, comes to a door in shadows.  He hears something on the other side, hesitates inches from the doorknob.  He leans down.
Blinking through the key-hole. P.O.V. OF AN EMPTY ROOM  -  A glimpse of motion  -  the d across the room (leading to a corridor?) is shutting.

WHITE pushes the door open, steps into the adjoining room No sign of life.  Cheap decorations.  He walks around cautiously.  Turns lights on.  Then reconsiders.  Turns t again.  Disturbed, he studies his features in a wall mirr ANGLE ON OPEN BATHROOM DOOR  -  the fish has jumped from again and is flapping on the floor. White steps back into the bathroom.  He picks up the fish doesn't know what to do with it, so he puts it in his poc

He searches through things.  A grey overcoat in the close goes through the pockets, finds a WALLET.  No I.D., just laundry bill, some money and a postcard from a sea-side t ANGLE ON A REVOLVER on the bed-side table.  He picks it u grip tightens on the handle, his finger applies pressure trigger and...

The gun goes off.  A BULLET RICOCHETS wildly around the r bounces off the metal bed-head, smashes a vase, embeds it in the wall. Startled, he holds the gun away from him like it might go again.  He examines it carefully now.  Opens the chamber. TIGHT ON THE GUN  -  Five bullets left. He turns the chamber carefully, shuts it, puts the gun in inside pocket of the coat. He moves to the bed.  A RIPPED PHOTOGRAPH on the rug.  A fragment of a woman's face, her left eye.  He lifts the fragment up.  There's handwriting on the back, part of a

head_text.subj: ...MEANS THE MOST TO ME. LOVE YOU

text: The rest is missing. He sits on the edge of the bed.  As he does this, he noti something else on the floor. HIS P.O.V.  -  follows a dark stain on the floorboards, t woman's bare foot behind the bed.  He stands abruptly, fu across the bed to stare into a dark corner of the room. In the shadows he can make out a woman's naked BODY lying pool of blood.  Her eyes stare lifeless. White stumbles back in horror, throws his hands across hi mouth.
White stumbles from the room, leans against a wall for su Lights flicker. At the end of the corridor, elevator doors open.  Light a musak flood out.
White staggers from the elevator, moves past a deserted f desk.  A VOICE from the back room:
Hey, you! You gotta message. White stops, looks uncertainly towards a bead curtain.
What?

Message in d'box!  You deaf? White sees several nooks for messages and keys in front o Reaching across the desk, he glances through the bead cur into the manager's office.  TELEVISION SOUNDS O.S. HIS P.O.V. Hard to see  -  the man sits in the chair, lit by the glo the T.V. set.  White grabs the note, looks at it.  A PHON NUMBER, also his room number, and what appears to be his JONATHAN WHITE.  That's all.  White thrusts the message i pocket.
Got my money?
What?  I...  How long have I been here?

Jeez, too damn long if you ask me! What about the two weeks y'owe me... Totally confused, White turns to leave, sees something. HIS P.O.V.  -  A painting on a wall (cheap print variety) waves on a beach.  A breeze rustles the pages of a calend pinned beside the picture. TIGHT ON WHITE  -  MOVE IN on his ear.  O.S. SOUND  -  su crashes on shore.  A WOMAN'S VOICE WHISPERS:
What is your name...  What is your name... He backs away from the painting, looks about the lobby in -  sees a sign:  TOILETS.  A painted hand points the way.
Hey! WHITE (without turning)
I'll be back later. MANAGER O.S.

Yeah.  Well, y'better be. CAMERA REVEALS A FIGURE  -  watching from a shadowy corne the lobby. As White runs out, the MYSTERY MAN picks up a pay-phone, Whispers into the receiver in a foreign language.
White pushes shakily through a red door, runs down a corr Pipes steam and drip water.  He rounds a corner, slips, n falls.
Puddles on the floor, stains on the walls. White bursts through the door and into a cubicle.  He ben over a toilet bowl and VOMITS.
He looks up, wipes his mouth on his sleeve.  A breeze tug his stringy hair.  A tiny ventilation grill above the cis looks out at the street.
Sheets of newspaper blow past.  A full moon, surrounded b blood red clouds, hangs above empty streets.

A WATCH  -  on a hairy wrist.  Seconds tick past.  Soft flickering light.  VOICES O.S. ANGLE ON FRANK BUMSTEAD  -  police inspector.  He looks d the watch.  Time to leave.  He STANDS, heads for an illum exit sign. Images flicker on a SCREEN.  The inspector rushes to the runs into an USHER, who gasps. BUMSTEAD (to usher)
Gesundheit! Bumstead quickly moves off.
The INSPECTOR makes a call, licks the tip of a pencil, scribbles in a notebook.  Behind thick glass, he argues soundlessly into a phone. BIG IN FOREGROUND  -  a popcorn machine rattles noisily.
The inspector is upset, face strained.  A MALE VOICE chat quickly through the receiver. BUMSTEAD (cuts in)
...but you told me the meeting was ten-thirty . A burst of chatter. BUMSTEAD
I know, sir, but I can't make it at nine-thirty ...  It's  -  um  -  well, inconvenient... A stream of chatter stops him. BUMSTEAD
Yes, sir...  I understand...  Yes... But, I've done fine so far without an assistant... The inspector tries to interject as the VOICE cuts in aga BUMSTEAD
But...  But I...  I... (defeated)
Nine-thirty.  Yes.
We are underwater.  WHITE's FACE swims into view.  Bubble from the mouth,  the eyes stare in horror.

White washes his face in a sink.  He looks up, wipes his dry with his coat.  He turns towards the door to leave. There are TWO  -  identical.  He cannot remember which he through.  Takes a guess, opens one and steps into darknes He realizes he's picked the wrong door, tries to go back the door CLICKS behind him:  locked.

Pitch black.  Trickling water.  A distant voice over a P. system recites names, followed by numbers.  A LIGHT, far White walks towards it. He steps into a bare concrete area, a public phone hangs blank wall.  He pulls a coin from his pocket, puts it in slot, dials the number on his message.  Ringing  -  no an Suddenly White feels cold. VOICE O.S.

There you are. Startled, White drops the phone and turns.  A figure move forward out of darkness: ANGLE ON THE MYSTERY MAN from the hotel lobby.  The stran wears a long black coat, dark glasses, and has extremely skin.  He is completely bald.  He studies White carefully White glances about nervously  -  walks back up the corri his eyes pinned to the man. MYSTERY MAN

You are lost, yes? White retreats faster. A FLASH OF STEEL  -  a dagger appears by the stranger's s gripped in a black leather glove.  He moves forward, a gr his pale face. White stops, backs against the wall. MYSTERY MAN

Co-operate.  Do not make this difficult. White panics  -  he's cornered.  He remembers the revolve pulls it from his coat and LEVELS it at the stranger, his shakes terribly. ON THE STRANGER continuing to advance.  Something about h eyes makes White immobile, unable to think clearly. MYSTERY MAN

You will not shoot, yes.  There is a place in your mind, a corner of darkness... THE GUN FIRES again and again.  Red splashes appear on th His shoulder.  His leg.  His neck.  He walks forward, wit spastic jerks as bullets RIP into him. A final shot POINT BLANK into the stranger's forehead.  A stream of black liquid spouts from the hole. Blue smoke clears.  The man stands motionless, his mouth open.  Then his eyes roll up, and he collapses to the gro
CLICKING of new leather shoes, walking, striking tiles. INSPECTOR BUMSTEAD strides down a silent corridor.  He re into his pocket, removes a SURGICAL MASK, places it over nose and mouth.
Bumstead steps up to a bald man with a moustache standing the end of the corridor.  The man, who is dressed identic to the inspector, is his superior:  CHIEF-INSPECTOR STROM BUMSTEAD
Good evening, sir. STROMBOLI
Yes.  This way. STROMBOLI leads the inspector into a tiled room containin several COVERED BODIES.  The two men are greeted by a che looking MORTICIAN. MORTICIAN
Welcome, gentlemen.  Youire early. Here for the examination, right? Stromboli nods, then ignores the mortician and walks alon row of corpses.  Bumstead follows. STROMBOLI
The handiwork of an extremely sick individual. He throws back covers to reveal horrible mutilations. STROMBOLI

Youive read the reports.  Not much to go on.  We know nothing about him, except that he likes to cut them... Always the same type of blade. Forensics match in each case... Anyway, it's all in the reports, read them for yourself. STROMBOLI shakes his head, turns away from the final body looks at the inspector. STROMBOLI
Why are you wearing that thing on your face? BUMSTEAD
Germs, sir.  These places are full of them. STROMBOLI
I see. (continues)
One thingis for sure, heis ambitious. Youill be a busy man from now on. MORTICIAN
You can say that again. Stromboli looks annoyed at the smiling man.  The Morticia becomes serious and goes back to his work. BUMSTEAD
What about Thompson, sir?  Wasnit this his case? STROMBOLI
Thompson suffered a kind of severe delusion or some damn thing.  Anyway he isnit with us any longer.  The case is yours.  Go through his files. Take what you need. (less business-like)
By the way, howis your mother? BUMSTEAD
Sheis getting better, thanks.  She... STROMBOLI (cuts in)
Very good... The chief-inspector turns, paces to the door briskly. STROMBOLI
Letis go, Bumstead.  So much to do and so little time.

A large faded BILLBOARD advertisement on a building facad portrait of a smiling woman clutching a product called, " O"  -  a cereal box carton. THE CAMERA MOVES IN STEADILY, rises upwards, CLOSER on th womanis face, finally enters a hole at the centre of her PAINTED IRIS.

A raftered room on the other side of the billboard.  CAME TILTS TO a convoluted staircase  -  at the base, the SHAD A MAN runs. FEET pace rapidly.  TILT UP TO REVEAL  -  WHITE. CAMERA FOLLOWS as he tries to lose himself from possible pursuers.  He steps through a low archway into a back all rounds a corner. A DEAD-END.  White stops, looks around, then up.  Heis br heavily, trying to catch his breath.  He starts to shake. ABOVE, the walls stretch into darkness.  An OPENING way u there  -  he can see stars.  Something dark crosses the g sky.  A RUSHING NOISE in the distance.  Wind starts to pi Trash is being kicked up.  A sheet of NEWSPAPER wraps aro Whiteis leg.  He tries to kick it away repeatedly but it come off.  He bends down, grabs it to throw it away, but something grabs his eye. He stares at the page for a moment  -  then his LEGS SLIP under him and he falls to the ground.  He holds his head itis going to explode.  A whimper deep in his throat.  Hi is trembling violently. PUSH IN TIGHT on the paper on the ground.  A front-page headline:  MAN-HUNT CONTINUES FOR SERIAL KILLER! White looks up  -  terrified.  The RUSHING NOISE O.S. aga HIS P.O.V. ON THE WALL facing him, a DOOR has appeared where moments before there was nothing.  The door creaks open to reveal ANOTHER DOOR WITHIN.  This one extends outwards on the en lengthening wooden shaft. White, stands quickly, thrusts the newspaper into a pocke Tries to side-step the ADVANCING DOOR but itis too late, only open it and step through, to avoid getting pinned to wall.
HAND-HELD P.O.V. THROUGH the swaying beads hanging in the room doorway.  TWO FIGURES peer into the room. FIGURE 1
We are looking for Jonathan White. THE HOTEL MANAGER looks up, moves forward into light:  a hunch-backed man with glasses.  He steps through the bead glares at the intruders. MANAGER

What for? ON THE MEN  -  an uncanny resemblance to the one who trie kill White.  Black coats, glasses, pale skin.  Creepy. A BLACK GLOVED HAND flashes forward, grips the manageris and doesnit let go.  The manager struggles, gulps for air Heis pushed back heavily against the wall. MAN 1
Which room is he in? The leather glove SQUEEZES, blood trickles from the manag ears, through the fingers.

ANOTHER (VERY SHORT) FIGURE is searching the room.  He he NOISES O.S. in the corridor, runs to the door, presses ag the wall. ON THE MAN  -  FREDRICK  -  a stunted body, an oversized thick limbs.  The rest of his features lost in shadow. The door swings open, a shaft of light floods the dark ro ON THE TWO MYSTERY MEN as they step in and look around. search the room, knock stuff over.  One of the men kicks womanis corpse in the corner.  Behind him, Fredrick, stil hiding near the door, slips into the corridor unnoticed.
A FLYING PERSPECTIVE past buildings.  An INSECT-LIKE BUZZ O.S.  Way down BELOW, in a canyon of silent buildings, a FIGURE walks.
A breeze pulls at WHITEis hair and coat.  He takes out th wallet  -  a few dollars.

The city is DEAD.  Empty.  Desolate.  Buildings hang down of black.  Day-time was never invented. As he puts the wallet back in his pocket, a BUSINESS CARD hadnit noticed, flutters to the ground.  He stops, picks In simple print:  DOCTOR D.P. SCHREBER M.D., a phone numb Scribbled handwriting on the back says:  Thursday 0930. ON WHITE  -  he glances across the street. HIS P.O.V.  -  A cafe.  A broken NEON FISH buzzes above t doorway.

He walks up rickety stairs, into a small room with five o tables.  Empty.  Dirty.  He sits and waits. A CLOCK ticks on the wall  -  midnight.  White coughs, fo attention. A NOISE from a doorway.  A SHADOW moves towards him, drag one foot as it walks.  A SMALL ASIAN WOMAN appears and li his table.  She speaks very quickly IN CHINESE.  He does understand. She points to a chalk board on the wall  -  a list of dis also in Chinese, only one in English  -  the last one.  A bottom.  In small print.  "NOODLES". WHITE (nods)

The noodles.  Iill have some noodles. The old woman rips a YELLOW TICKET from a pad, gives it t White.  A number on it.  She points her crooked finger ag at a SPEAKER BOX above a small serving window in the wall greenish fluoro pulses from the room within. WOMAN

We call. She leaves again. White looks about the empty room.  Insects are zapped on illuminated DEVICE hanging on the wall.  An old air-condi RATTLES noisily. NOISES from the kitchen  -  voices argue in Chinese, a ba cries.  Then SILENCE. White removes the newspaper from his coat and spreads it table. He overcomes his fear, starts to read the article.  Leans forward, hands trembling.  Without realising, he holds th paper OVER A CANDLE burning on the table.  The paper CATC FIRE, is engulfed.  He drops the flaming page on the tabl the table-cloth starts to burn. White is frantic.  On a nearby table he finds a pitcher o water, and dumps this on the flames.  It kills the fire b leaves a black hole in the table-cloth.  The paper is ash He moves to another table pretending nothing happened, fa smoke away.

BUMSTEAD is moving quickly.  He suddenly trips and falls floor.  He curses under his breath, then looks up. HIS P.O.V. A door  -  THOMPSON:  DETECTIVE/INSPECTOR on the frosted Bumstead stands, pushes into the office.
A total mess  -  paperwork everywhere, dozens of used cof cups, rotting food in greasy paper bags.  Bumstead shakes head. BUMSTEAD

A real shame... He starts to look around. TIGHT ON FILING CABINET  -  a drawer is pulled open. Thompsonis files are also a mess.  Bumstead continues to his head.  He reaches for a file.  A loud SNAP! BUMSTEAD (screams)
He recoils.  A mousetrap has snapped over his fingers.  H pulls it off his hand, throws it to the floor, cursing.

White is still waiting for his food. He leans down to scratch an itchy ankle, lifts his trouse to examine the bites  -  worse, inflamed.  He uses a napk wipe at the pus. AERIAL PERSPECTIVE OF A FLY  -  circling the room, lookin on White. ON THE FLY  -  It lands on a plate of half eaten food on another table.  The creature is some kind of SURVEILLANCE DEVICE  -  half insect/half machine.  Itis spying on him. IN TIGHT as inbuilt camera lenses focus in its head.  It on the food behind it. White is oblivious to this.  Heis finished examining his is sitting quietly.  He yawns.  His head nods forward bri A NOISE.  White looks up. A TRAP-DOOR has opened in the ceiling.  Two feet in black leather shoes descend from the hole.  A sea breeze blows through the room.  The SOUND OF SURF, SEAGULLS CRYING. ON Whiteis nose twitching.  He can smell the ocean. The WALLPAPER COMES ALIVE  -  like a seething tangle of w One by one, THREE MEN in black coats lower into the room, floating on air.  They pull out knifes, step forward. ON WHITE rigid with terror. ON THE MEN  -  though their faces cannot be seen clearly gloom, they too resemble the MAN who confronted White ear They walk towards him slowly, holding knifes above their Ready to attack.  They lean over him, pause dramatically. MAN 1
Donit fall asleep. (chuckles softly)
Might never wake, yes. This Man turns to the others.  They all smile, then turn to White. MEN (in unison)
Fifty-six. ANOTHER VOICE has been speaking softly  -  now it is loud Repeating: VOICE

Fifty-six...  Fifty-six... ANGLE  -  a chair falls to the floor. White leaps up from the table, terrified, disoriented.  J DREAM  -  he had dozed. WIDEN ANGLE  -  The place is still empty.  White glances serving window.  A DISH waits for him, framed in the glow fluoro square.  He gets it.  A bowl of soupy liquid with noodles.  He sits down. He is about to start eating  -  realizes he has a fork in of a spoon.  Picking up the bowl again, he heads to the kitchen.
He takes a door beneath a set of wooden stairs and finds himself in another corridor.  He looks about, unsure whic direction to go in.

White is lost, still holding the soup. He moves through a number of RUSTED METAL DOORS that open shut automatically.  Each reveals another room or corrido Deserted spaces long forgotten  -  dusty, crumbling. He feels the fish moving about in his pocket, pulls it ou looks at it. White holds the dying fish in one hand, the bowl of cold in the other.  Disgusted, he puts the fish into the bowl.
White stops.  Looks up.  A large clock suspended from the rafters.  A tug at his coat. Standing beside him is FREDRICK  -  the little man from W hotel room. FREDRICK (stutters)
Where have you been?  The doctoris been worried about you. WHITE
What?  Who are you? Fredrick looks nervously down the corridor. FREDRICK
Cimon, letis go!  We donit have any time. The little man grabs Whiteis sleeve, starts to pull him a WHITE
Hold it a minute.  Letis start at the beginning, huh? ANGLE ON  -  the top of a set of stairs in front of them. dark figures appear. Fredrick looks up at them in horror. FRERICK
Shit! (looks at White)

Quick!  Run! Both men run like crazy, White awkwardly holding the bowl soup.  They come to a junction, each takes a separate cor Fredrick finds some stairs, climbs two at a time. White climbs INTO FRAME, looks around, finds another corr The little man is nowhere to be seen.  White reaches anot junction  -  several corridors branch off.
Each passageway completely deserted.         WHITE
Shit.                                        He keeps running.

A PHOTO FLASH  -  illuminates the dead body of the hotel slumped in his own blood. Bumstead leans INTO FRAME, examines the corpse.  He notic several stab wounds in the manis abdomen.  Various cops s the room. One cop walks up to the Inspector. COP
We got another one upstairs BUMSTEAD (deadpan)
Great.

A SMALL ROOM with arched windows that look over the city. Fredrick is pulling a notebook and pen from under an uptu table. He scrawls rapidly, screws the message into a tight tube, puts it into a METAL CYLINDER he finds beneath the table He glances out a window, notices A FIGURE standing beneat street-lamp below, looking up at him.  Startled, Fredrick back into shadow, goes to a wall covered in about a dozen vertical PIPES running up into the ceiling. TIGHT ON ONE OF THE PIPES  -  he opens a small hatch and the metal cylinder in it.  The cylinder is snatched from hand, sucked into the pipe with a rush of air.
Fredrick steps back, a sigh of relief.  A shadow falls ac his back.  He turns.  He screams.

TIGHT  -  rushing along lengths of rusted pipe, at blindi speed.  The cylinder races around corners.  It clanks and grinds.  HURTLES up the side of a building.  THEN PLUMMET underground.  Rushes through darkness.

THE CAMERA MOVES along a bridge-like structure.  An enclo corridor supported by rotting wooden pylons.  Under the b pipes spew sewage into stagnant water. ANGLE ON WHITE WALKING  -  seen through a series of illum dirty, windows.  He occasionally glances into the bowl he before him.

TIGHT ON the fish swimming weakly in the soup. ANGLE ON WHITE  -  He stops, looks up at O.S. SOUND of clattering metal.  A pipe runs the length of the corridor the invisible clanging cylinder races away, into darkness Then the silence is shattered by a piercing series of SCR somewhere in the building.  White hurriedly moves towards source.

White rounds a corner, stops, notices a small rectangular in a wall.  ANOTHER SCREAM, weaker now  -  He runs to the in the wall and looks through. HIS P.O.V. A small, very ordered ROOM.  A fake fireplace bathes the in a warm glow. White cranes his neck forward, stretches his head through hole.  He can see into an adjoining room to his right  - dark figures stand over a man on the floor lying in a poo dark crimson.  The man looks up  -  itis Fredrick  -  jus both dark figures stab him repeatedly with bloody daggers doesnit scream this time, just gags on blood running from mouth. Suddenly a sliding door SLAMS onto the back of Whiteis ne traps his head in the hole.  He struggles, tries to free himself.  Drops the bowl of soup.  It shatters on the har floor, makes a mess. INSIDE THE BATHROOM  -  The killers look up at the smashi noise. BACK IN THE CORRIDOR  -  White pulls with all his strengt The door gives and he stumbles backwards.  He is about to away but glances at the floor. The fish is flapping about  -  still alive.
White darts from a doorway, trips and falls.  He sprawls base of sweeping stone steps.  He looks at a building tow above him.  Chiselled in the facade, above the entrance: LIBRARY.

A series of ply-wood SILHOUETTES race through frame.  Sto suddenly, mechanically.  LOUD GUNSHOTS.  Chunks of ply-wo blast away violently. BUMSTEAD is practising his marksmanship. A HAND  -  on his shoulder.  He whips around, startled. ON MISS CRENSHAW  -  a young, stiff-looking woman. BUMSTEAD
Dammit! MISS CRENSHAW
Sorry, sir. BUMSTEAD
Donit ever sneak up on me like that! Who are you? MISS CRENSHAW
Patricia Crenshaw. She puts out her hand. MISS CRENSHAW
Iim your new assistant. BUMSTEAD
I didnit requisition a secretary. MISS CRENSHAW
The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand. BUMSTEAD (uncertain)
Oh. He takes her hand tentatively.  They shake. MISS CRENSHAW

Iive taken the liberty and had Inspector Thompsonis office searched, as I believe you instructed.  All clear now, sir.  They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories... Poor man. BUMSTEAD
Good. MISS CRENSHAW
You wonit regret this, sir. BUMSTEAD
Fine. Bumstead moves off.

White steps into a vast, empty room, stops beneath a big saying, SILENCE in formal letters.  The place seems aband then he notices a hint of movement.  Cigarette smoke snak into the air, a light, across the expanse of polished flo He walks up to an elderly female LIBRARIAN sitting behind desk, smoking, reading.  White looks somewhat distraught WHITE
Keep newspapers here, birth certificates, records of deaths, that kind of thing? The librarian looks up from her book. LIBRARIAN
Which would you like  first
WHITE
Okay.  Newspapers. She takes her glasses off.  Her eyes are TINY, like pin-h She studies White. LIBRARIAN
Are you alright? He looks around  -  restrained panic. WHITE (looks at the woman)
Sure.  Iim fine. LIBRARIAN (nods)
Mmm-hmm.  Stairs at the end of the hall.  Third floor.  Turn left. Section C-7.  Row 35, near the toilets. She replaces her glasses, watches White rush away. LIBRARIAN
Donit mention it... She blows her nose into a handkerchief.  The snort ECHOES LOUDLY.

White rushes down a dark hall lined with bronze statues. finds section C then walks between towering rows stacked old volumes.  Comes to number 7. He follows an arrow past row after row  -  finally finds but then it skips straight to letters again, A, B, C, etc No Row 35. He stops and looks around  -  sure enough a door displays small sign:  TOILETS. White is sweating profusely.  He now sits on a chair, tak his shoes, rubs his feet.  He pulls a book from a shelf b him, looks about, opens the book and tears several pages folds them, stuffs them into his shoes to plug up the hol He gets up, tries to backtrack, comes across an elaborate diagram of the library interior.  An arrow points to a se near a wing labelled:  MAPS.  Near the arrow it says:  YO HERE. He keeps walking. He finds the door to the maps wing but the door is locked sign is nailed to it:  WE ARE REMODELLING.  WE APOLOGIZE INCONVENIENCE. White, annoyed now, tries to force his way in.  Puts his shoulder to the door, pushes several times.  It CRUMBLES his weight  -  rotten. He finds himself in a DUSTY ROOM. HIS P.O.V. A narrow room, filled with rows of bookshelves with stack old newspapers. TIGHT ON WHITE  -  he steps forward, pulls a folded newsp off the shelf.  The instant he picks it up, it crumbles t in his hands.  He picks up another, and another, each in breaking apart and dissolving to nothingness.

TWO SILHOUETTED FIGURES face each other across a polished table.  They speak in a foreign language.  A phone rings. Figure 1 picks up the receiver and listens attentively. Figure 2 is involved with various metal shapes he is tryi lock together.  A complex puzzle.  He gets impatient with puzzle, dashes it to the floor. Figure 1, on the phone, hangs up and writes something.  H the note to Figure 2, who in turn drops it into A CHUTE.

The note falls from a slot in the wall before Figure 3 (i shadow yet again).  He reads from the note over a silver microphone, still in the unfamiliar tongue. TIGHT ON A SPEAKER  -  his distorted voice.  A final myst person  -  Figure 4  -  listens to the announcement.  He a stick and moves a small cut-out figure of a man across board, away from a large grouping of similar cut-outs.  T board resembles a planning table in a war-room. A HIGH ANGLE as the CAMERA PULL BACKS on the grouping of out figures.  More and more of them.  Ten.  Twenty.  A hu A sinister army.
White is in a phone booth.  He removes the note from his pocket, dials.  No answer again.  He dials the OPERATOR. muffled voice over the line. WHITE
Iim trying to reach nine zero eight triple two.  I canit get through... (beat)
What?!... (angry)
Shit! He reaches into his pocket, pulls out a coin, puts it int slot.  Heis sweating again.  He wipes his brow with a tre hand. WHITE

It is?...  Which area is that number listed in?...  Is that near the ocean?...  The  ocean ...  Never mind. Have a Jonathan White listed?... WHITE.  Seventeen?  All Johns?  I see...  Never mind. I can't talk about  that .  As long as you understand, that's all. The room is very dark.  Bumstead is assailed by a wave of putrid smells.  It's a mess  -  rotten food, overturned furniture, dirty clothes. THOMPSON

Pull up some garbage  -  make yourself at home. Thompson smiles weakly.  They sit down, face each other i gloom.  A RAT scuttles past Thompson.  With lightning ref he throws a shoe at it.  The rat runs under a table.  He back at Bumstead, smiles, slightly insane. THOMPSON
They've taken my mind, my memories... BUMSTEAD
What?  Who has? THOMPSON
Is that your idea of a joke?  I don't remember... (looks around)
Take my advice, Bumstead.  Get off this case.  Now. BUMSTEAD
What is going on? THOMPSON (looks more frightened)
Wish I could tell you, Bumstead. Strange business.  I...
He screams horribly.  Stands, clutching his head.  Startl Bumstead falls backwards off his chair.  Thompson, still clutching his head, runs and starts POUNDING HIS FACE aga the wall. THOMPSON

Get away!  Leave me alone! Thompson's head is CHANGING  -  bloating.  It rapidly elo into a pink fleshy tube. Thompson's head continues to grow -  his features are los beneath folds of skin.  His screaming is stifled.  Thomps falls to the floor.  His head HUGE NOW  -  larger than hi body.  Small tendrils sprout from the main appendage. Bumstead takes cover behind a sofa. Then, as violently as the head began to transform, it sto Bumstead peaks over the sofa at the huge throbbing purple growth sprouting from Thompson's collar.  At the top of t growth an orifice opens. An EXPLOSION of green bile spouts into the room  -  cover everything in sight... Then the head starts to shrink.  Thompson's features appe again. It returns to normal size.  Thompson groans, spraw the floor, clutching his head. Bumstead looks on in horror. THOMPSON
It's  -  it's disgusting, I know... Thompson's face is heavily bruised, covered in sweat.  Hi starts to bleed  -  he wipes it on his sleeve. BUMSTEAD
Jesus!  We have to get you to a doctor... THOMPSON
No...  No doctor... Bumstead stands unsteadily. BUMSTEAD
But...  How long has this been happening? THOMPSON
A few days...  a few weeks  -  dunno, I can't remember. (stands slowly)
Worse thing is, I never know if it will change back again...  Now, please leave me alone.

WHITE, ELIZABETH and SACHIKO sit around a small table, ea quietly. Without warning, Elizabeth starts to cry again.  White tr ignore her. Sachiko looks sadly at the wife, puts a hand shoulder, gives her a handkerchief.  The woman quietens d They resume eating but in no time Elizabeth again bursts tears.  White looks at her now. ELIZABETH  (through sobs)

Sorry... Sachiko leans across and puts her arm around Elizabeth, h her to her feet.  Elizabeth hangs onto the woman as she i from the room.  White can hear the sobbing still, as the move through to the bedroom.
They sit on the edge of the bed  -  Sachiko holds Elizabe hand, smiles at her. ELIZABETH (calmer now)
I'm sorry...  This is embarrassing  - my husband doesn't know who I am... With this, she starts to cry again. Sachiko leans forward and tenderly kisses Elizabeth's lip
TIGHT ON TWO MYSTERY MEN speaking in whispers.  The Men continue talking as THE CAMERA RISES, through several lev concrete and machinery TO REVEAL:
OTHER MYSTERY MEN are rigging a wire to some kind of ante device.

head_text.subj: BACK DOWN IN THE DARK CHAMBER

text: The group of MYSTERY MEN have gathered once again.  One addresses them all. MYSTERY MAN
The line of junction between two edges! MEN  (unison)
MYSTERY MAN
We have located him.  Now is the time, yes. A switch is thrown.  Electricity sparks to life.  A hum i the air. MYSTERY MAN

Let the tuning commence! The congregation of MEN place ELECTRODES to their forehea a trance-like manner.  They chant, quietly at first, stea building in volume.  The MEN stand and MOVE RHYTHMICALLY some inner beat. The CAMERA MOVES ACROSS to a diagram pinned on a board. representation of a man's legs.  Trousers rolled up above knees, showing a number of bite-like wounds on the flesh. Labels point out various parts of the legs in medical fas -  the legends are an unknown language.
The antenna glows with a ghostly green light.  O.S. SCREA RISE UP FROM THE STREET.

White downs a cup of black coffee, staring blankly out th window.  O.S. distant screams. He glances across to a wall, notices A FLY there  -  some about it looks WRONG. FLY'S P.O.V. A distorted electronic image of White's FACE looming up. At exactly that moment the FLY TAKES OFF, flies erratical down the hall, around a turn and disappears.  White follo

White moves quietly towards the bedroom door. HIS P.O.V. It is ajar, dark inside.  Movement.  The women are naked bed.  The JAPANESE WOMAN has her eyes shut, head back in ecstasy. The WIFE is bent over her, kissing her stomach. ANGLE ON WHITE  -  watching through the crack in the door women are oblivious. He moves away slowly, feeling strange.  His feet stop mak contact with the floor.  He grabs a table to steady himse The table-cloth comes away, things spill to the floor and smash. He's FLOATING. White desperately reaches out to grab something, holds th light-fixture in the ceiling.  It breaks off in a cloud o plaster.  Sparks briefly illuminate.  He falls heavily ON CEILING  -  now the floor.  The apartment is upside down. He stares up at furniture and objects.

White steps into the room, eerily illuminated by a glowin heater stuck to the floor.  Water is running  -  filling tub and overflowing, making a suspended puddle above Whit head. White takes off his clothes and climbs the wall, towards floor.  It's difficult, but he reaches the tap, turns it Pulls himself towards the tub. Gravity becomes NORMAL AGAIN as he sinks in the warm wate He's incredibly weak  -  floats limply in the bath.  Subm his face.  A distant throbbing O.S., like a huge machine somewhere in the building. He opens his eyes, still underwater, stares up at the cei HIS P.O.V. A blurry DARK FIGURE moves into his vision.  It stares do him. White rigid with fright, cannot focus on the figure throu thin veil of water.  The FIGURE reaches out.  A GLOVED HA grabs White about the throat, holds him forcefully.  Whit gulps for air, swallows water.  His eyes widen.  He tries stop the hand strangling him but can't. Suddenly the hand pulls away.  The BLURRY FIGURE stumbles and ERUPTS into bloody explosion.  The body splits apart, throwing internal organs through the room. White awakens in the bathtub.  He looks about the room. Silent.  He gets out of the water, starts to dress.
BUMSTEAD'S car pulls up.  He gets out, stained here and t with bile.
A HIGH ANGLE on the slain bodies of the JAPANESE WOMAN an WHITE'S WIFE.  TWO COPS wander about the dark room, doing stuff.  Bumstead walks up to the cop in charge. COP
All the same entry wounds.  It's definitely him. (indicates Sachiko's corpse)
She lives...  lived here.  A prostitute. BUMSTEAD
The other one? COP
His wife. BUMSTEAD
Jesus.  Small world. (looks around)
Where's the photographer? COP
No one available. A third YOUNG COP steps up to the cop in charge, glancing the bile on Bumstead's suit. YOUNG COP
They won't come out. COP

We'll interrogate them anyway. The cop leads Bumstead behind a WOODEN PARTITION.  A smal neatly arranged  -  a double bed, various possessions.  S obviously lives here.  The room is empty however. COP
This is the family of the victim  - apparently they were in the apartment when he committed... BUMSTEAD  (looks around empty room)
What are you talking about? COP
Oh, yes... He walks to THE BED, bends over and lifts the bed-spread. the shadows underneath, Bumstead can make out SEVERAL FAC man, an old woman, three or four children. COP
They don't speak English... BUMSTEAD
How will we interrogate them? COP
Well, sir...  I don't know exactly. Under the bed, Bumstead can see a LITTLE GIRL.  He walks to her.  She puts a hand over her mouth, edges away. BUMSTEAD

It's alright.  I won't hurt you. Without coming out from under the bed she hands the inspe crumpled paper.  He looks at it then glances over his sho HIS P.O.V. The wooden room divider.  The CAMERA MOVES IN steadily, i crack running along the length of the divider  -  we can the room on the other side, with the cops moving about. Bumstead looks back at the page he holds in his hands. HIS P.O.V. A child-like DRAWING.  Two men, stick figures, dressed in black, with impossibly big knifes, slash at two screaming women. Unmistakable  -  MYSTERY MEN.

DOCTOR SCHREBER walks stiffly into the room and sits at t head of a boardroom table.  He's cold, pulls his coat up his neck.  The long table is lined on both sides with imm MYSTERY MEN. A DARK FIGURE walks into the room, steps up to the other the table.  This is the enigmatic MISTER BLACK  -  only e seen hidden in shadow. MISTER BLACK  (addressing Men)
Gentlemen. (peers at Schreber)
Doctor. He sits, dark and mysterious. MISTER BLACK
I have called this meeting for a purpose, yes? (turns to Schreber)
It is clear to you we are  - unhappy, yes? SCHREBER
Yes, of course.  I... MISTER BLACK

The tuning failed  -  when our agents arrived he was gone.  He  knows things -  predicts things.  Explain to us, Doctor.  Why is the situation this way?  Yes? Schreber seems distinctly uncomfortable. SCHREBER
I'm not certain I fully understand myself... MISTER BLACK
No excuses, dearest Doctor!  Answers. Yes? MYSTERY MEN  (chant in unison)
Answers!  Answers! MISTER BLACK
You said this would be containable! Nothing works this time.  Why is this so? MYSTERY MEN
Why!  Why! SCHREBER
I  -  ah  -  I...  it's a little cold in here don't you think? MISTER BLACK
We must find him.  This is your responsibility. SCHREBER (thinking fast)
Yes, of course...

Bumstead once again scratches his head in front of a map. little girl's drawing is pinned to his board.  His attent wanders.  He notices a FLY CRAWLING across the wall in fr his face.  He leans closer, studying it. The intercom crackles to life.  The insect flies off. MISS CRENSHAW  (through intercom)
A call, sir. BUMSTEAD
Who is it? MISS CRENSHAW
Won't say.  Says he must talk to you. BUMSTEAD
Put it through... A light flashes.  Bumstead picks up. BUMSTEAD
This is Bumstead.  Who is this? He listens intently.
BUMSTEAD enters.  He looks nervous.  His SECRETARY sits a desk in an adjoining office, filing her nails. BUMSTEAD
I need everything on the Jonathan White case. MISS CRENSHAW
Yes, sir.   Everything
BUMSTEAD
All the important stuff.  Wrap it up for me. The inspector turns to face her, a little manic. She is s at him. BUMSTEAD
Please  -  I'm in a hurry. MISS CRENSHAW (evenly)
Certainly.
BUMSTEAD steps from the doorway and walks across to his c briskly.

Bumstead moves down a long corridor full of people in tow and swimming outfits, waiting silently.  They sit lined b wall, staring into space. Bumstead walks into a larger tiled room, full of steam. walks beside a heated pool  -  naked people swim about we or sit on the edge washing themselves.  He steps up to A DRESSED MAN, sitting silently on a bench.  It is WHITE. A feint smile brushes across White's lips as he looks up inspector.  He looks away, like he's forgotten something. Stands, walks over to the pool, cups his hand, bends down scoops some water. Bumstead sees White has picked up the LITTLE SILVER FISH. BUMSTEAD
Why give yourself up? WHITE
I  -  ah - couldn't think of anything else to do.  I thought maybe you know something... (beat)
I'm scared. BUMSTEAD
That was a pretty good escape act at the station.  How did you do that? WHITE
I woke up in a subway.  I don't know how I got there. BUMSTEAD  (not convinced)
Uh-huh. (pauses)
What are you scared of? WHITE
People...  after me. BUMSTEAD
Who? WHITE
I don't know who they are. BUMSTEAD
Why are they after you? WHITE
Don't know that either. BUMSTEAD
Don't know much, do you?

Metal scraping. PIANO ACCORDION MUSIC wafts on a breeze, someone breathin HIGH ANGLE  -  Down through an OPENING metal hatch.  A di laboratory IS REVEALED  -  a maze of scientific instrumen Elongated shadows move about. MYSTERY MEN are hunched over something.  Behind them a diagrammatic chart of the evolution of the human brain. MAN 1 bends across to a CONTROL PANEL, works a switch.  A speaker in a metal box crackles to life.  SOUND OF DISTAN
VOICE

What is your name...  What is your name... Wires lead from the metal box to a HUMAN BRAIN within a metallic container.  Electricity arches across electrodes More sounds from the speaker:  WATER BUBBLING.  HIGH HEEL DOWN STAIRS.  BED-SPRINGS.  LOVERS MOAN PASSIONATELY. MAN 2 steps forward and pulls a bloodied sheet from their handiwork. A PUPPET-LIKE CREATURE is revealed.  Small  -  two and ha feet tall.  The top of its head an open hatch containing BRAIN.  Wires lead to this. TIGHT ON PUPPET'S EYES  -  They glance about the room. It is a series of geometric shapes and polished surfaces. MAN 1 shines a torch into the puppet's eyes.

Gears turn, illuminated by the beam of the light.  The ge part slowly to reveal a small writhing INSECT screwed to metal plate. MAN 2 shows the puppet PHOTOGRAPHS:  WHITE as he looks currently, shots of him as a teenager, a young boy, a bab Photos of what we realise are his parents, standing on a seaside pier sirtiling and waving.  Where he went to scho red push-bike he owned as a boy.  His first sweetheart. photo of a young woman smiling  -  his WIFE. MAN 3 holds up a small sea shell to the mechanical ear of puppet creature  -  MORE SOUNDS OF SURF... A FIGURE clutching a wooden cane looks on from the shadow His pale hand fondles the ornate handle of his cane  -  a carved silver insect.  It's MISTER BLACK.  Man 3 steps up him. MISTER BLACK
You have duplicated the personality, yes. MAN 3
It is ready.  The Doctor was most helpful. Mister Black turns towards the OTHER MEN. MISTER BLACK
I hear a clock in my head, and I like it! MEN  (respond in unison)
We hear clocks in our heads, and we like it! MISTER BLACK
A world in our likeness! MEN

A world in our likeness! The Men close the hatch in the top of the puppet's head. SQUEAK...  CLUNK!  The puppet tests out its MANY WEAPONS, series of nasty-looking blades snap out of its small body retract.
Bumstead leads White through the front door, into a SITTI ROOM.  Everything is extremely neat and organized, plasti coverings on all the furniture.  White steps towards a so BUMSTEAD

Please.  Not that way.  If you could just follow the covering  -  the carpet gets stained and it's impossible to clean. White stops. Bumstead indicates a CLEAR PLASTIC MAT runni through the room. BUMSTEAD
Everything the department knows about John White is in this.  Here. (hands file)
Excuse me for a moment. White flips through it.  Details of White's history.
Bumstead removes an empty suitcase from a closet.  Begins place neatly folded clothes within it. BUMSTEAD (calling to White)

Age thirty one.  Brown hair.  Green eyes.  Five feet, ten and a half inches tall.  Until recently worked for a firm manufacturing scientific equipment.  Wife's name  -  Elizabeth. Father and mother  -  Harold and Edith.  Both dead.  A history of mental instability...  etcetera, etcetera. Bumstead walks back into the sitting room, packed bag in He looks at White leafing through the file. BUMSTEAD
That stuff helpful? WHITE  (disappointed)
I suppose... (looks up)
Why are you helping me? BUMSTEAD
You're case has been driving me crazy.  You see, I pride myself on being thorough.  There's too many loose ends with your case. (a beat)
Thought it was best you were hidden until we understand more about the facts.  What do you know about these men in black? White looks up, pauses as if he didn't understand Bumstea then: WHITE
If you shoot them here... (points at his forehead)
you can kill them.  They're not people  -  like us  -  got insects in their heads...  Got any disinfectant? The inspector is caught off-guard by the question. WHITE  (continues)
It's my legs.  Been bitten.  Giving me trouble. Bumstead walks silently to the bathroom, opens a medicine cabinet. BUMSTEAD  (to himself)
Insects? He returns clutching a small bottle and some cotton wool. BUMSTEAD
Here. (hands things to White)
Careful with your trousers.  That stuff stains. The inspector gives white back his revolver and his walle BUMSTEAD
Here. Bumstead paces thoughtfully, careful to stay on the plast protective covering.  He turns, glares at White, who dabs legs with the cotton wool. BUMSTEAD
Any idea what part the Doctor plays in this business? White shakes head. BUMSTEAD
Let's try and find out, shall we. (points at White's shoe)
Lace is untied. White looks down.  Bumstead doesn't lie.
The BARBER is shaving under the armpit of a client.  GRAN snores in a corner, his feet buried under a pile of hair clippings.. The BELL hanging above the door rings.  The door swings o BARBER
He with you shortly, sir... Several heads turn, THEN LOOK DOWN to see the PUPPET.  Th puppet wheels forward and stops. BARBER (not really looking)

Hello, sonny.  Cute outfit.  Mother get it for you? The puppet crosses the room threateningly.  TWO OTHER CLI look up startled from their newspapers and girly magazine ON THE PUPPET  -  it wheels up to the barber's leg and GR TROUSER with a mechanical claw.  The puppet holds out a P OF White. PUPPET (incoherent obscenities)
BARBER (looks down, scared now)

Huh? He's grabbed and THROWN into a nearby chair.  The puppet onto the bench in front of him  -  he's frightened, so ar customers. Puppet wheels up and down on the bench in front of the customers  -  stopping to glance at individuals in a thre manner, holding out the photo of white. It leans forward, spinning its blades  -  HAIR FLIES.  Sc o.s. The PUPPET retracts its weapons  -  COVERED in blood.  It wheels forward, through the door and into the street. THE CAMERA PANS to reveal a scene of complete carnage.  B covers the walls.  FOUR BODIES slumped about the room.  E an outlandish hairstyle.
White looks at the inspector  -  street lights pass over features.  Bumstead stares at the road. BUMSTEAD

I didn't tell you the entire reason I helped you.  It started with two little girls.  Twins.  Used to play with them when I was young.  Couldn't remember for the life of me what they looked like, then I understood why... He looks at the dashboard, brushes away a small piece of BUMSTEAD
They didn't have faces. WHITE
What? BUMSTEAD

That's right.  Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads.  No mistake.  I just hadn't remembered it that way.  Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory. (looks back at White)

That's not all.  Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had... inconsistencies.  It was like a game. I would think about a person or a place, or an event.  Then I would turn the lights off.  Sit down in a comfortable chair...  And study each detail of this subject. He glances at White, then back to the road. BUMSTEAD
Everything was liquid beneath a thin surface that had always seemed solid to me... Bumstead and White are quiet momentarily, then: BUMSTEAD
Is there anything you haven't told me about this business?  Even the most insignificant thing? WHITE (thinking)
No.  Nothing I can think of. Except... BUMSTEAD
Go on. WHITE
Well.  The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean.  The point is no one seems to know how to get there. BUMSTEAD
Why, that's ridiculous.  You just... He trails off.  Shakes his head slowly. BUMSTEAD
We'll get to the bottom of this.  I mean it.
The doctor is sitting at his desk, when the door bursts o suddenly.  White and Bumstead move into the room and grab doctor before he can protest. BUMSTEAD
I met a friend of yours the other night, doctor.  Tall fellow.  No hair.  Rather pale skin... SCHREBER
I don't know what you're talking about. BUMSTEAD
That's surprising.  He was leaving your office at the time... SCHREBER
You are mistaken. WHITE
What are you hiding? SCHREBER
Nothing.  I don't know anything! BUMSTEAD removes his revolver, sticks it in the doctor's SCHREBER
Please, they'll kill me... BUMSTEAD
I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.
SCHREBER, BUMSTEAD AND WHITE sit in Bumstead's car in an alleyway. Schreber points to a SOLITARY METAL DOOR in a wall. SCHREBER
In there. BUMSTEAD

Just like that? The threesome step from the car, keep close to a wall. Schreber alone steps up to the door, leans down to a mat foot of the door, lifts it and takes a KEY from underneat unlocks the door, opens it, puts the key back, goes insid waves the other men forward. White and Bumstead step up to the door  -  Bumstead looks mat  -  it says:  WELCOME on it.
Through the door  -  AN ELEVATOR.  There is only a down b Schreber presses it, several seconds later the doors open They step inside.  The doors close, the lift descends. BUMSTEAD
What is this place? SCHREBER
You wouldn't believe me if I told you, Inspector.  Have patience  - you'll see for yourself. When the doors open again the three men look out on a DAR PASSAGEWAY.
The PUPPET wheels up to the sweeping set of stairs at the of the building.  It stops, WHEELS BUMP into the steps repeatedly.  It looks down and shrieks with a string of mechanical obscenities.
WHITE and BUMSTEAD follow SCHREBER down a corridor to wha appears to be an ancient crypt.  They enter a door  -  it something written on it in a strange language.
They stumble around in the darkness, Schreber finds a lig switch, suddenly White STOPS dead in his tracks  -  Bumst turns to him. WHITE

Look. White points to a wall featuring a line of brass hooks. these hooks hang MYSTERY MEN coats -  that's not all.  Ea carries A FACE. Bumstead and White step closer, look at the faces.  They be elaborate, very life-like MASKS. SCHREBER
Put them on. White and the inspector look at each other, incredulous.
The door opens.  White, Bumstead and Schreber step out, w poorly fitting masks and coats  -  DISGUISED AS MYSTERY M

The three men come across a small area with a raised plat between arches.  A number of OPEN CARTS roll past on trac the scene resembles some bizarre amusement-park ride.  Th are numbered on the side  -  all of them empty. SCHREBER

Get in.  Hurry. White, Bumstead and Schreber hop aboard.  The cart takes into a DARK TUNNEL, deeper into the secret underworld of MYSTERY MEN.  They MOVE THROUGH a subterranean landscape unexplained contraptions and bones. WHITE (to Bumstead)
Where do you think this goes? BUMSTEAD
It sure isn't the fun-fair. The cart finally comes to a stop in a cave.  Bumstead, Wh Schreber leap out and hide in a dark doorway, as a LONG L MYSTERY MEN walk past them. SCHREBER
Follow me, and do exactly as I do. They join the end of the line, falling into step.

The MEN, with WHITE, BUMSTEAD and SCHREBER in tow, enter sit in a number of rows of wooden chairs.  White and the inspector do the same. MORE MYSTERY MEN appear in circular portals high up on th concrete walls.  ONE MAN faces the others at the front of room. MYSTERY MAN 1
Eleven past eleven  -  the Night of the Eye. The seated Men start to CHANT. MEN
A MAN in the front row stands. MAN 2
The Eye is too small for the head of the pin! MAN 1
Yes! ANOTHER MAN stands.  Next to the first, who sits again. MAN 3
What is it that floats on the water? The Eye! MAN 1

Indeed! So it goes around the room, each Man takes his turn annou part of the strange ritual.  It will be White, Bumstead a Schreber's turn shortly.  White is worried, looks at the others. WHITE (whisper)
What do we do? SCHREBER (hisses back)
Fake it! BUMSTEAD
What? SCHREBER is next  -  he stands abruptly. SCHREBER
The eye.  Master of time and space! Then it's Bumstead's turn. BUMSTEAD
The Eye  -  um  -  delicious with horseradish on rye! MAN 1 at the front seems confused for a moment  -  SEVERA the others turn towards Bumstead. MAN 1 (uncertain)
Good. The inspector sits back down  -  whispers to White withou looking at him. BUMSTEAD
Nothing to it... White stands.  Hesitates.  Then: WHITE
Eye...  eye, captain! White sits down, shaking his head, embarrassed. MAN 1
Um  -  yes... THE MAN NEXT TO WHITE rises up  -  keeps rising, FLOATS I AIR above the Men's heads. MAN 4
My spine will bend for the Eye! He turns sideways, still floating.
BACK ABOVE GROUND, Bumstead, White and Schreber run from door at the end of the alley-way, tossing their masks awa BUMSTEAD
Was that for real down there? SCHREBER
I'm afraid so. The inspector stops walking suddenly, grabs White, holds back. BUMSTEAD
What the  hell is that? At the end of the alley the PUPPET advances menacingly. Schreber takes his chance and runs down an alley and disappears. BUMSTEAD

Quick.  My car. Fortunately BUMSTEAD'S CAR stands nearby.  The two men le start it up.  Bumstead guns towards the puppet standing i glare of the headlights. The puppet's head opens, a TINY PROPELLER pops out, spins lifting the puppet into the air.  The car passes beneath speed.  Screeches off into a street, races along between buildings.
WHITE
What now? BUMSTEAD
This ocean business...  I know where I can find a map.  I need to go back to the station.  Where will you be? White thinks for a moment, pulls the paper his wife gave from his pocket. WHITE
I'll go see an uncle of mine. (reading)
Five  -  one  -  eight  -  three  -  double six  -  three... Bumstead scribbles on the pad mounted to the dash, battle the wheel, driving at breakneck speed. BUMSTEAD
Good. (looks in rear mirror)
Uh-oh... White turns and looks behind them. HIS P.O.V.  -  HEADLIGHTS gaining on them. ON THE PUPPET  -  sitting AT THE WHEEL of a stolen car, d like crazy.
White takes out his gun  -  AIMS at the rapidly approachi car. WHITE  (remembers)
It's empty. BUMSTEAD

Take mine. Bumstead pulls a gun out of his coat.  They swap. The puppet PULLS ALONGSIDE, a mechanical arm extends towa Bumstead's front tire.  A SPINNING BLADE extends from the of the mechanical arm. PUPPET

TIGHT ON THE BLADE heading for the spinning wheel.  White fires.  Shells hit the PUPPET'S car, shattering windows. THE BLADE cuts into the tire  -  it pops loudly, goes fla metal SPARKS off the road. White is thrown forward, hits his head on the dash.  Bums fights to keep control, SWERVES into the side of the othe vehicle, making it scrape a concrete wall, hits garbage c flying. The PUPPET'S car falls behind  -  then swerves off into a street and disappears. BUMSTEAD  (looks behind him)
Where did it go? WHITE  (looks back also)

Don't know. Both look FORWARD AGAIN  -  to see the PUPPET'S CAR pull front of them, BLOCKING THE WAY.  Bumstead's car is going fast.  Slams the brakes. TIGHT ON PUPPET  -  Screaming with insane joy as Bumstead approaches like a bullet.
BUMSTEAD
Jump! Bumstead rips the phone number from the pad.  The two men The car continues onwards.

In the glow of the flaming wrecks, the two men pick thems up from different sides of the street.  Look at each othe turn and head in OPPOSITE directions. CAMERA MOVES IN on mangled metal  -  a MECHANICAL CLAW st to pull itself from the wreckage.

White steps up to a SMALL DOOR in the side of a building. sign above the door depicts an underwater scene, crammed fish, sea-weed, bubbles floating to the surface.  Dominat everything is a GREEN MAN with scales  -  a KING NEPTUNE-

White stops in front of a ticket booth, beside a faded bl curtain.  In the booth a TICKET SELLER is snoring with hi hanging open, his head sagging. White knocks on the windo man wakes with a start. TICKET SELLER
Yeah.  That's what I said! (looks at White  - rubs head)
What..? WHITE
I'm looking for this address. The man squints at the card White holds up, nods groggily TICKET SELLER
Upstairs.  Through there. He thumbs the blue curtain.  Curls up, shuts his eyes aga
